titleStmt.title: James F. Robinson to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG13626

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Active Militia Records - Capital Guards, North Cumberland Btn., and Three Forks Btn.
msIdentifier.idno: Box 76, Folder 864-865 1st REGT CAPITAL GUARDS CO F Frankfort Bn CORRESPONDENCE

body.p:
Georgetown 11 Aprile 1864
Gov. Thos. E. Bramlette

Dear Sir -- This will be handed by Mr. A. Tipton, of this county. He is a reliable worthy gentleman, and true Union. His son, under Eighteen years of age, against his consent, has joined Capt Edwards Company State Troops. He wishes your order to release him. He can give clear proof of his age. I advised him, that, upon being satisfied of the facts, you could and would order his discharge; without his being put to the resort of writ of Habeas-Corpus

Gov. Thos. E. Bramlette
Frankfort
Kenty.

Mr A Tipton
Stamping Ground
Scott Co
Ky
Genl Lindsey will attend to this matter
